item.title: Will someone please give me a hand? Please?
item.dc:creator: @gergy008 gergy008
item.description:
@gergy008 wrote:

Hi,

My server runs on 562 (Not sure on the server type but I think it’s 562 loading 614 or 604) and for some reason the client doesn’t seem to connect very well. The client loads and I can see all the worlds in the worlds list for my server but I can’t connect to them through the login page. It just stops for a moment on Performing login… and says ‘Error connecting to server’. After the client connects I get a message in the server window saying ‘Please initialize the log4j system properly’, Could this be preventing clients from connecting? The port forwarding is fine I used port scanners and they detect the server just fine, so it IS online.

The only thing I can think of is that I didn’t put my IP in the client correctly. I checked on client.java and it’s correct, is there any other places it needs to be? In Class_8.java there are loads of different server IP’s with no explanation on why they are there:

public boolean g(byte i) { do { try { String string = getDocumentBase().getHost().toLowerCase(); if (string.equals("jagex.com") || string.endsWith(".jagex.com")) return true; if (string.equals("runescape.com") || string.endsWith(".runescape.com")) return true; if (i != -61) return false; if (string.equals("stellardawn.com") || string.endsWith(".stellardawn.com")) return true; if (string.endsWith("skillerownage.no-ip.org")) return true; for (/**/; ((string.length() ^ 0xffffffff) < -1 && string.charAt(-1 + string.length()) >= '0' && string.charAt(string.length() + -1) <= '9'); string = string.substring(0, string.length() + -1)) { /* empty */ } if (!string.contains("privateftp.no-ip.info")) break; } catch (RuntimeException runtimeexception) { throw pf.a(runtimeexception, new StringBuilder("gk.J(").append(i).append(')') .toString()); } return true; } while (false); return true; }

Read full topic
item.source: Will someone please give me a hand? Please?
